posts.post_content:
Behold the new queen of Magic, and not just Standard, mind you. The new Liliana is appearing on everything, from the title screen for Duels of the Planeswalkers 2012 (in which she has a killer deck) to the boxes included with Innistrad Fat Packs and even on the front page for magicthegathering.com. Liliana Vess has literally taken over all things Magic. Truly, the new dominant force in the Multiverse, at least until Bolas decides to gett off his ancient ass.
  
   
@stay70573 Yes.

posts.post_content:
@Lord of Shadow - It's similar to legend rule except the subtype is all that matters. People played Jace Beleren in order to kill Jace, the Mind Sculptor. So 1![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) Jace Beleren basically could be "Destroy Jace, the Mind Sculptor" or keep opposing players from playing their Jaces.
  
   
So basically Liliana Vess and Liliana of the Veil would kill each other since they can't exist at the same time.
posts.html:
@Lord of Shadow - It's similar to legend rule except the subtype is all that matters. People played Jace Beleren in order to kill Jace, the Mind Sculptor. So 1 Jace Beleren basically could be "Destroy Jace, the Mind Sculptor" or keep opposing players from playing their Jaces.

So basically Liliana Vess and Liliana of the Veil would kill each other since they can't exist at the same time.

Posted By: Judgemaster_Rolan (11/8/2011 11:19:17 AM)

posts.post_content: Didn't see why this card was so highly sought after at first. I opened my 3rd and 4th ever booster packs today, and in the 3rd I got a foil Liliana of the Veil. The level of control you achieve with her abilities is astounding, and being a 3-drop she can reach her ultimate quickly, before your opponent has much of a chance to build up a significant board. Wonderful planeswalker, very glad to add her to my new U/B deck. 5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I have made a deck that already takes advantage of her. I can kick of her ultimate mulitple times in game just for the fact BW Decks are really good at control. Mirran Cruaders and Phyrexian crusaders with her are really mean which is another feature to combo with her but I really like the fact that I have my play set of her. But I still have to admit she is really expensive at the moment for most people to use so she will either pull a gideon or a Jace 2.0 and start out expensive and go down or just stay expensive.

posts.post_content: Where I live, my opponents fear her. I put together a Standard "Sunburst" deck using Gideon, Jace, Chandra, 2 Relentless, and Liliana . . . they would opt to remove her first before the others. To be able to use her ultimate is such a rush to see your opponent just sit there and watch as I divide what they got. It's better to activate it as soon as possible, believe me.

posts.post_content:
......  
yeah, I'd totally tap that. (searches Gatherer for things that tap Planeswalkers)  
  
Case File: Liliana Vess, A Vorthos Dissertation-- Part One  
*Lorywn*-- Liliana Introduced. Demonic debt hinted at. *Shards of Alara*-- [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas) returns. [Malfegor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malfegor) killed and eliminated as candidate for one of Liliana's Demon Masters. **Agents of Artifice**-- Liliana trades Demonic Debt for Bolas Debt, except that Bolas isn't even sure he can keep his promise, and it's not like he ever intended to anyway. I conclude they are about equal, that Liliana and Bolas could do it together, and that as Black-aligned Planeswalkers that both have a love of pacts, deceit, and betrayal, the idea of using basically White strategy (alliance) is insane. We know these are the Top Dawg Demons because Bolas fears their combined power.   
  
**Curse of the Chain Veil** (cancelled) original sequel to Agents of Artifice. Almost certainly it tells the whole story, or... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
......
yeah, I'd totally tap that. (searches Gatherer for things that tap Planeswalkers)

Agents of Artifice-- Liliana trades Demonic Debt for Bolas Debt, except that Bolas isn't even sure he can keep his promise, and it's not like he ever intended to anyway. I conclude they are about equal, that Liliana and Bolas could do it together, and that as Black-aligned Planeswalkers that both have a love of pacts, deceit, and betrayal, the idea of using basically White strategy (alliance) is insane. We know these are the Top Dawg Demons because Bolas fears their combined power.

Posted By: phyrexiantrygon (1/14/2012 7:57:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Opened it in my second Innistrad booster. First Mythic I ever opened. I knew she was good, but definetly not worth her hideously high price at the time, so I immediately sold her for a big bunch of boosters. I don't regret it at all - first because her price now has halved and I got [Army of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Army of the Damned), [Past in Flames](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Past in Flames), [Mayor of Avabruck](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mayor of Avabruck), [Heartless Summoning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartless Summoning) and a foil [Splinterfright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinterfright), and second because of my Vorthos reasoning: it's what Liliana herself would have wanted me to do in that situation. I got a nice deal for myself and she probably got paired with a player who had the resources necessary to build a kick-ass deck with her.
posts.html:
Opened it in my second Innistrad booster. First Mythic I ever opened. I knew she was good, but definetly not worth her hideously high price at the time, so I immediately sold her for a big bunch of boosters. I don't regret it at all - first because her price now has halved and I got Army of the Damned, Past in Flames, Mayor of Avabruck, Heartless Summoning and a foil Splinterfright, and second because of my Vorthos reasoning: it's what Liliana herself would have wanted me to do in that situation. I got a nice deal for myself and she probably got paired with a player who had the resources necessary to build a kick-ass deck with her.

Posted By: Lash_of_Dragonbreath (1/9/2012 12:22:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I like to play this Liliana with [Genesis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Genesis). You discard Genesis into grave yard and then return any other creatures into your hand. You can do a combo with many creatures that have ability when come into play such as [Solemn Simulacrum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solemn Simulacrum) or [eternal witness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=eternal witness) to help reviving all the strong creatures in your graveyard to your hand.
posts.html:
I like to play this Liliana with Genesis. You discard Genesis into grave yard and then return any other creatures into your hand. You can do a combo with many creatures that have ability when come into play such as Solemn Simulacrum or eternal witness to help reviving all the strong creatures in your graveyard to your hand.
